ravelry com/stores/emmacrochetdesign4u instagram @annaluciadu lace lace dream lace socks a pair of easy and fun lace socks to knit actually knitted socks is one of the most precious presents you can give to your friends and relatives compared to large garments socks are quite easy and fast to knit in this pattern i write instructions using magic loop method you can always ajust it to your own preference either with dpns or short circulars this pdf features in magic loop version 1 for lace chart / cable knitting we recommend this beautifully crafted chart holder for a better knitting experience you can check it out it is free shipping for most of countries https //www etsy com/listing/1552100217/annaluciadesign-chart-holder- knitting yarn regia sock tweed【fingering weight 】 70% wool/ 25% polyamide /5%viscose 100g/ 400m for knitting 1 pair of socks you need to buy 1 ball 2 needle size hiyahiya mini interchangeable needles 2 5mm with cable length 80cm they are smooth and quite flexible when knitting in the round for sock circumstances in magic loop method gauge 32 sts and 44 row with 2 5 mm in 4 /10cm in stockinette stitches finished measurements after using sock blocker size 1 / 2 leg length 3 6 9cm for all sizes leg circumference 7 5 18 75cm /8 20cm foot circumference 7 3 18 75cm /8 20cm foot length without toe 8 20cm / 8 4 21cm total sock length measured from back heel all the way to the toe 9 6 24cm / 10 25cm ready to cast on let s go cast on 60/64sts using german twisted cast on or any cast on that you think is elastic enough for the cuff distribute evenly on 2 needles with magic loop method you should have 30/32sts on each needle join in the round carefully making sure you do not twist any stitches needle1 is your first needle and it is for plain stockinette sts needle2 is your second needle and it is for instep sts = chart a cuff rnd1 *k1 p1* repeat ** around rnd2 *k1 p1* repeat ** around rnd3 k around rnd4 p around repeat rnd1-4 another 2 times rnd13-14 *k1 p1* repeat ** around round k around 3 leg of the sock needle1 is your first needle and it is for plain stockinette sts needle2 is your second needle and it is for instep sts = chart a rnd1 k 30/32 on needle1 k chart a patten repeat 2 times【size 1】/ k1 k chart a pattern repeat 2 times k1 【size 2】 on needle2 repeat rnd1 and work chart a until you have completed chart a in total 8
